item.title: Bins blocking the pavement, 12th December
item.description:
I logged this before but nothing was done about it - There didn't seem to be a more relevant category but this side of the road never put their bins away and they are always blocking the pavement - this makes it very difficult for pedestrians, people with prams and especially for wheelchair users
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Hemstal Road, Kilburn, Greater London

item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Soggy leaves on pavement need clearing, 12th December
item.description:
There needs to be a sweep of the pavement from South Hill to near the bottom end of Elmstead Lane. There are a large amount of leaves that are now all mulched and take up a lot of the pavement space, but they are always wet and therefore very slippery so could be a danger to anyone walking up or down that section of road. Given there is also a light out halfway down this section, it is difficult at night to see where is safe to walk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: The Watch House 9 Holly Place, 12th December
item.description:
The heritage street light attached to our grade 2 listed property has been damaged by youths attempting to burgle us. The electric box is hanging off the wall attached only by cable ties the whole thing which is heavy is at risk of falling off.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Holly Walk, West Hampstead, Hampstead, Greater London

item.title: Illegal dumping: mattress and hoover abandoned on the street, 12th December
item.description:
Yesterday it was a Hoover, and last night a mattress. This is unacceptable. This needs to be cleaned up today. The street is not a dumping ground. HACKNEY COUNCIL: Do your job and take action immediately.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Londesborough Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tables and chairs at the top of Lion Road/Broadway new coffee shop by the hall, 12th December
item.description:
There are all tables and chairs on the pavement with umbrellas on. It is blocking the pavement and is near a zebra crossing making it dangerous to cross. Please can they be removed asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Lion Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dirty bin and waste on main New Kent Road with dirty water and poo, 12th December
item.description:
The bin outside Lebanese Grill and other two adjoining restaurants or food shops is very repulsive and this has been so everyday. Many school children with parents walk on the footpath on New Kent Road to reach Ark Globe Academy and they can hardly find space to walk. My son has asthma diagnosed recently and the stink is also unbearable. The entire street is so unhygienic it looks more like an underdeveloped country than UK. It is an eyesore. Problem is possibly the animal products these restaurants throw in the bins that overflows and tips outside or stinks up the street even if inside. It really should not be so. We deserve a clean, green and aesthetically pleasing environment as well as good smelling fresh air and clean streets and footpaths to walk on daily. Thos is a recurring issue. Please promote cleaner greener vegan businesses and plant based shops and move these unsightly bins away far from the path where kids walk.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 171, New Kent Road, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All along merrow Street se17, 12th December
